abstract: Since last month, Citigroup has struggled to find a replacement for Charles O. Prince III, its recently resigned chief executive. It has looked inside the sprawling financial giant; it has examined the firm’s alumni (some of whom left the firm unwillingly); it has cast its eyes on the top executives of its rivals.
lead_paragraph: Since last month, Citigroup has struggled to find a replacement for Charles O. Prince III, its recently resigned chief executive. It has looked inside the sprawling financial giant; it has examined the firm’s alumni (some of whom left the firm unwillingly); it has cast its eyes on the top executives of its rivals.

headline.main: A Dark-Horse Candidate for Citi’s Top Job?
